alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 12:37AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FAIRFIELD AND NORTH CENTRAL HOCKING COUNTIES THROUGH 100 AM EDT... At 1237 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Pleasantville, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Pickerington, Canal Winchester, Baltimore, Buckeye Lake, Bremen, Millersport, Pleasantville, Hide-A-Way Hills, Fairfield Beach, Royalton, Lithopolis, Amanda, Thurston, Stoutsville, Carroll, Sugar Grove, Rushville, West Rushville and Fairfield County Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
